moves.1. c4 Nc6: I don't know what this opening is called.
moves.2. d3 Nf6: Black is starting to develop his two knights.
moves.3... d6: !? Hmmm.... d5 was better, and either cxd5 or c5 breaks the pawn chain. Something like Nc3, dxc4, dxc4 then Qxd1+ and it doesn't look to good for me. Luckily he played d6.
moves.4. e4: Trying to develop my two bishops.
moves.4... e5: Well, if he does the same, then hopefully that means I can't move d4, or can I? d4, exd4. Nxd4, Nxd4, then Qxd4, and I have an early queen. (If you want to know more about the early queen, see annotated game: Early queen effects the game)
moves.5... Bg4: Uh-oh, but I don't leave it, because, again, I don't want to get a early queen, nor a doubled pawn, so I move...
moves.6. Be2: ...Be2 to block it. I also prepared to castle in a situation like this.
moves.6... Bxf3: Exactly, but do you believe that a bishop is worth slightly more (B=3 and a half, N=3 and a quarter) than a knight, or do you think they are worth the same?
moves.7... h5: I think your going for Ng4.
moves.8. h3: h3's good, because 1. it stops the knight from moving to g4 & 2. it leaves a hole so when I castle, there's not much chance of back rank mate happening either.
moves.9... g5: ? I don't think Black is watching where he is putting his pawns. What's more, it's gonna be dangerous if he's gonna castle kingside.
moves.10... Bg7: Sort of like copying me, just to the wrong square. Anyway, the knight's still pinned!
moves.11... O-O: He wants to castle. But now the rook's moved, I can capture that black pawn on h4.
moves.12. Bxh4 Ne7: ? Oops! I think that was just a mistake. Qd7 was the same.
moves.13. Nxf6+: I take it with my knight first.
moves.13... Kh8: But he doesn't recapture at all.
moves.14. Nd5: I move back to d5, attacking the knight. Black should've recaptured.
moves.15. Nxe7: All done and good. What do you think black shoud've done?
moves.16. Bxe7: I capture it as easy as a pie!
moves.16... Qxe7: While the queen copes with the recapture right after.
moves.17. Bg4: I just didn't know what to do, so I kept the queen of my bishop's diagonal, and the rook moving to c8.
moves.17... Qh4: I'm not gonna try the threat of g3, I'm gonna move my bishop. just.
moves.18. Bd7 Qf4: Now, I wonder why he moved there for.
moves.20. Bf5: Trying the threat of Qh7+, but now black's defence is looking fine.
moves.22. Rfc1: People usally move Rac1, but, for the Queen and bishop both on the black square, I need to cope with the nifty Qh2+!
moves.23. c5: Trying to get my rook out.
moves.23... dxc5 24. Rxc5: Now I'm really trying to attack.
moves.24... Qd2: But is he trying to defend himself, or attack?
moves.25... Qxb2: Funny queen, I thought it was trying to defend.
moves.26... Qxa2: Black does not sense what I'm up to.
moves.29. Qg6+: I'm gonna capture that bishop. Mate in 3., First move.
moves.30... Kd6: Aha, here come the spectacular mate.
moves.31. Qc7#:
Qd7 was the same, but Qc7 just looked more astonishing!

A very fine, standard checkmate.
